intro: Statice parvifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf sea thrift, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit and dense clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant thrives in salty, well-drained soils and is often found in dunes, cliffs, and coastal grasslands. Its narrow, linear leaves are adapted to reduce water loss in arid or windy environments. Statice parvifolia is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and its ability to stabilize coastal soils.
